properties.name: 19th and Wasco
properties.description: Posted by MearaDave does not want to mow the parking strip lawn anymore and loves the idea of a community garden where many people help and share in the harvest. Keep an eye on http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?topic=24011&post=563950&uid=137572905304#post563950 to hear more about how to participate.

properties.name: 22nd x Multnomah
properties.description: Posted by Meara First planted in 2009, this tidy plot is unique for its hand stacked stone totems. If you\'d like to participate, knock on the door of the house and let Debbie or Dan know that you are "garden ready"

properties.name: 24th and Multnomah
properties.description: Posted by MearaSean and Darlene have an incredible, wide parking strip that they would love to convert to a vegetable garden as part of this program. Sean is a great gardener and also is a worm compost expert who would love to work with others on that project to reduce our waste and make yummy compost. They seek other neightbors and maybe some of the foks from the nearby apartments to work the garden with them, share in the harvest, share water costs and provide food extra food for the hungry. Watch here for more updates or http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?topic=24011&post=563950&uid=137572905304#post563950 For more information

properties.name: 24th and Wasco 2
properties.description: Posted by Meara2332 NE WascoWith the success across the street, Meara and Philip will turn over part of their parking strip to plant squash and cukes that need slightly less sun than the tomatoes and peppers that will grow across the street. It should be considered part of the same garden.

properties.name: 24th x Wasco Garden
properties.description: Posted by Meara First planted in 2008, these two raised beds were enthusiastically contributed by the rental property owner along with access to water. It not only garnered community cred, but also reduced the landscape maintenance that he had to do (win-win!). The garden, in its first year produced enough tomatoes, chili peppers, basil, green beans and strawberries to satisfy those who tended it and also nearly 40 pound of food for the Oregon Food Bank. We plan to be even more productive in 2009. Oh the abundance!!!!

properties.name: 25th and Clackamas
properties.description: Posted by MearaEsther is intrigued with the idea of a shared veggie garden. It is less commitment than doing it all herself (even with the forced labor she can get from her strapping sons and Stepan!) and she likes the idea of growing food for folks that really need some help. Talk to her if you are interested in a veggie collab!

properties.name: 27th
properties.description: Posted by MearaChris Lopez is interested in working with neighbors on this short block to start a community garden. Go to http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?topic=24011&post=563950&uid=137572905304#post563950 to find out more and connect with Chris to make it happen.

properties.name: Anastasia's
properties.description: Posted by MearaInvetrate Soup Nighterand 2008 Golden Ladle recipient Anastasia has graciously volunteered her parking strip and yard (nice southern exposure!) for others to garden. Water can be negotiated with Anastasia. It should be a win for all involved! Check back later for contact details

properties.name: Kitchin home
properties.description: Posted by Dkitchin  2526 NE WascoWe would like to share our space with others. Call us at 503-287-0742 if you would like to join us - Jim and Debbie Kitchin

properties.name: Matt and Gina
properties.description: Posted by MearaFrom a random comment at their very first SoupNight, Matt and Gina have been added to the map as a possible community garden location. They just moved into the neighborhood a month ago. What better way to avoid having to cut the lawn and also to connect with neighbors? Clackamas from 22nd to 24th is a giant prarie of veggie garden possibility. Who else on the street might be interested in some HOT HOT HOT veggie on parking strip action?!

properties.name: The Gnome Garden
properties.description: Posted by Meara I\'m going out on a limb here and volunteering Alice and John\'s fabulous parking strip. If you are on this block an agree, let them know that you\'ll join the project and y\'all can work it out together for fabulous food based community
